ENGLISH: A few changes that can only be made this way.
AI: 1836 Setup

This tweak will stop anarcho-liberal ideology from spawning. It may help performance a bit. Some people think they are too unrealistic for them, so they might want to disable it. I didn’t test any balance issues that might arise without them in the game though.
Option: Disable Anarcho-Liberal Ideology
Disables the immigration into province events such as Ethnic Flavour or Intermarriage as they can become spammy and not everyone likes them.
Option: Disable Immigrant Assimilation Events

Disabling the Bankruptcy events will stop you from getting the CB and effects that happen when a country goes bankrupt on you. It won’t stop the event for the AI nor will it stop countries going bankrupt.
Option: Disable Bankruptcy Events

Within TGC are a number of flavour events and decisions which help both the AI and the player to follow a historical colonisation path in Africa and Asia. You may prefer to play without these leading to more unpredictable colonisation.
Option: Disable Colonial Railroading

This will enable you (and the AI) to justify protectorates/concessions on any province anywhere except China. By default, you can justify these CBs on bordering or port countries, while inland gets unlocked by Scramble.
Option: Enable Early Colonial CBs

This is for players who want to see an almost certain mini-ww1 in 1853. By default, the chance Austria intervenes is 15%. This will make Austria almost certain to join the Crimean War. Which side you ask? Well, I guess you'll see. Prussia will react to either side Austria chooses.
Make Austria Certain to join Crimean War

The Commie Mod content is a bit volatile and buggy at the moment so it is disabled by default, if you desperately want to try it out you can enable it here. Bug reports about it are still welcome please just don't complain how it broke your game.
Option: Enable Commie Mod
Easter Egg events are flavor events that don't impact the game in any real way but serve to just be something interesting to see in specific circumstances.
Option: Disable Easter Eggs

TGC has intergrated some ahistorical and wacky submods allowing players to take their nation down implausible alternative paths. You may prefer to play without these. (The AI will never take major ahistorical options regardless of this decision)
Option: Disable Extra Flavour

In TGC, crises only start after 1870, when Revolution and Counter-revolution is researched and an event fires. This is to stop stuff like independent Ireland in 1840 because of the militancy that the famine generates, among other weird crises. Selecting this option will remove these restrictions and allow crises to happen from the start of the game, like it happens in vanilla Victoria 2.
Option: Enable Crisis From The Start

Activate this if you do not want the microstates of Andorra, Liechtenstein, Monaco, San Marino, Couto Misto, Mt. Athos,and Neutral Moresnet in the game. It removes their cores and annexes them to the nearest country.
Option: Disable Microstates
This will hide all optional tweaks to vanilla TGC. You still have until 1837 to change your mind though.
Hide ‘Options’ Decisions
This option will remove all starting party loyalty.
Option: Remove Starting Party Loyalty

Historically the UK did not ally major european powers, and so in TGC the UK is forced to break alliances with any Great Powers who aren't Portugal, Belgium, Japan or the Ottomans. You may wish to turn this off.
Option: Disable Splendid Isolation For The UK

This option will disable decisions which allow a Great Power to unite some of their spherelings into a culture union puppet (Italy, Iberia, Scandinavia, Yugoslavia, Romania, Arabia, Transcaucasia, Turkestan and the United Baltic Duchy) as some players consider these to be OP and prefer to play without them.
Option: Disable 'Unite as Puppet' Decisions
Disable events for political leader modifiers.
Option: Disable Leader Events
Disable Choose Trade Policy decisions for all countries (as opposed to choosing disable in the event which only disables them for you).
Option: Disable Trade Policy decisions

A few province events related to the workplace, such as ‘The Old Man and the Sea’, ‘All the Tea in PROVINCENAME’ and ‘Blood and Iron Mine’ can get quite spammy. I increased the MTTH and tried to balance it out, adding more requirements, but if you still find it spammy, you can use this option to completely disable them. Keep in mind that I didn’t test balance with these events disabled or anything like this, and this might help improve performance a little bit. A few events that only trigger because you have no or low workplace safety standards are still in though. Pass workplace reforms if you want to get rid of them.
Option: Disable Workplace Events
Disable the decisions to commission a warship from another country or take a warship commission from another country.
Option: Disable Warship Commission decisions

Sometimes in this world, nations seem to be blessed by God in certain periods. Their leaders are brilliant, their people are hardy, they excel in warfare, produce amazing works of culture, and their economies boom. Do we live in such a world? If Lucky Nations are enabled ten random (non-great power) civilized nations and five random uncivilized nations will be given special powerful bonuses that will enable them to shake up the status quo.
Option: Enable Lucky Nations
Money hoarder modifiers will trigger when a country has too much money in its stockpile and reduce its tax efficiency, forcing money back into the economy.
Option: Enable Money Hoarder Modifiers

This decision shows all optional decisions to tweak and change the game’s behaviour from vanilla TGC. This, along with all decisions it enables, will disappear January 1st 1837 to reduce clutter, so you have a year in-game to pick and choose what you want. Once a tweak is chosen, you can’t disable it anymore, so if you mis-click you need to edit your save or start a new game.
Show ‘Options’ Decisions
This decision allows players to access override decisions which give them greater control of their country's borders and conscription by bypassing some vanilla mechanics.
Option: Enable Override Decisions
Disable ‘Winds of Westernization’ events for spectator games as an uncivilized nation.
Option: Set Up Game In Spectator Mode

With this option, AI USA will NOT get events to reduce its influence in Africa, as historically the USA was not interested in Africa beyond Liberia. This will not affect a player USA. Keep in mind if you enable this, you will likely see weird Yankee things in Africa.
Option: Enable USA influence in Africa

Bans the 7th and 8th Great-Power from influencing nations through diplomacy (although not through the use of CB's and other ways of earning influence). For people that like a game with less nations meddling with global affairs.
Option: Enable Minor Great-Powers
Enable the optional mechanic that limits the situations where the AI can mobilize, stopping them from throwing their economy down the Grand Canyon for every little war.
Option: Enable Mobilisation Limiter
Our immigration laws and our policies towards the borders of our country are ours and ours alone to decide, and we think it might be time to revise a few rules.
Change our Border Policy
We decided that our country is good as it is and there won’t be any changes in our immigration policies.
Hide the Border Policy Options
This hides the overide decisions from view to reduce clutter.
Hide 'Override' Decisions
This decision shows a number of player only decisions which allow you to force through certain law and RGO changes, as well as using province immigrators.
Show 'Override' Decisions
Cancel the current ongoing growth campaign.
Stop the Ongoing Population Campaign
Start a campaign to trade infamy & tax-efficiency reduction in-exchange for more overall pop-growth.
Commence a Population Growth Campaign
This will increase your pops going to colonies
Start a Colonial Settlement Campaign
This will stop the settlement campaign
Stop Colonial Settlement Campaign
Start a campaign to actively promote to our citizens better living conditions and pay at home, rather than emigrating overseas
Start an Anti-Emigration Campaign
Stop the Anti-Emigrationg Campaign
This will stop the Emigration Campaign
Start Internal Migration Campaign
This will increase the number of people moving from state to state provinces within your country.
Stop Internal Migration Campaign
This will stop Internal Migration campaign.
Commence a Diplomatic Offensive
Instruct our Foreign Minister to commence a campaign to improve our standing in the world
Stop Diplomatic Efforts
This will stop reducing infamy at a faster rate.

A closed border is a border that prevents movement of people between different jurisdictions with limited or no exceptions associated with this movement. These borders normally have fences or walls in which any gates or border crossings are closed and if these border gates are opened, they generally only allow movement of people in exceptional circumstances. In case of emigration as well as immigrations, departing ships are inspected for illegal emigrants. These controls and checks come at the cost of an increased demand from the State’s bureaucracy.
Close the Borders

A conditionally open border is a border that allows movement of people across the border that meet a special set of conditions. This special set of conditions which limits the application of border controls that would normally otherwise apply could be defined by an international agreement or international law, or the special conditions could be defined by a regulation or law of the jurisdiction that the people are claiming the right to enter. Conditionally open borders generally requires a claim to be submitted from the people who are proposing to enter the new jurisdiction stating why they meet the special conditions which allow entry into the new jurisdiction. In the case of our country, quotas mean that no foreigners that fail a literacy test in their own language or are nationals of countries that were or are at war with our nation are allowed. These controls and checks come at the cost of an increased demand from the State’s bureaucracy.
Implement Immigration Quotas

An open border is a border that enables free movement of people between different jurisdictions with limited or no restrictions on movement. A border may be an open border due to intentional legislation allowing free movement of people across the border, or a border may be an open border due to lack of adequate enforcement or adequate supervision of the border. One of the advantages of such a policy is that it requires little to none effort from the State’s bureaucracy to keep control over immigrants.
Abolish Immigration Restrictions

This decision converts 1 province to a farming RGO of your choosing. The options are Wool, Timber, Cotton, Cattle, Fish, Fruit and Grain. For whichever you select, one province currently producing one of the other resources will be converted. This can be done once every 12.5 years.
Change Farming RGO

This decision converts 1 province to a mining RGO of your choosing. The options are Coal, Iron and Sulphur. For whichever you select, one province currently producing one of the other resources will be converted. This can be done once every 25 years.
Change Mining RGO
There is currently no Host set. The Host is the only player who can select gameplay options at the game start.
Claim the role of Host
You are currently the Host. If you renounce this role another player can claim this role and select gameplay options.
Renounce the role of Host
This will hide the utility decisions.
Hide 'Utility' Decisions
The decision shows a mix of tools and decisions to facilitate small changes and fixes during gameplay.
Show 'Utility' Decisions
The 'Global Pop Reduction' decisions will disappear from this game session and won’t reappear again. You won’t be able to use these decisions again for this game.
Disable 'Global Pop Reduction' decisions
Your decision list will now be uncluttered.
Hide 'Global Pop Reduction' decisions

The 'Global Pop Reduction' decisions will reduce all the pops in the world by a specific factor. This can help increase performance on low-end machines but can also cause unpredictable issues with mechanics that depend on specific pop size thresholds. Use at your own risk.
Show 'Global Pop Reduction' decisions
The ‘Release Vassal’ Menu will open allowing you to choose what nation to revoke the vassalage of.
Open ‘Release Vassal’ Menu
The ‘Return Cores’ Menu will open allowing you to choose what nation to return cores to.
Open 'Return Cores' Menu
We are still not decided on the direction our nation research should take.
Hide 'Choose A Tech School' decisions
If we are to advance as a nation, we need to pick a direction for our research.
Choose A Tech School

Our coffers are full enough and members of the cabinet have put forward the proposal of exempting our vassals, not the substates, from contributing to $COUNTRY$’s treasury. This tax break would boost our relations with them in the short term, but wouldn’t benefit our finances in any way.
Exempt Vassals from Contributing to our Treasury
The earlier tax break offered to vassals has run its course. We need that every vassal of $COUNTRY$ to do their part and contribute to the maintenance of $COUNTRY_ADJ$ glory.
Oblige Vassals to Contribute to our Treasury
This will allow us to give grants to other players. It must be activated before a player chooses to request grants. It can be reversed at any time.
Gain A Standard General
To reduce the impact of RNG on multiplayer this decision allows any player to gain a single +2 attack general at any time.
Enable Giving Grants
This will prevent us from getting events when other players request grants. It can be reversed at any time.
Disable Giving Grants
This will mean we no longer will receive grants from other players.
No More Grants!
This will request a grant from other players. Please note they must have chosen the decision to enable giving grants for the request to go through. It can be reversed at any time.
Request A Grant
Start a Research Campaign
We can redirect some of our annual budget to help along our scientists research for our country.
Stop the Research campaign
Stop funneling budget funds to research
Show Direct Migration Control

This will open the decision menu that lets you control your Direct Migration Campaigns. To learn more how DM works, once you enable the menu, enact decision "Immigration Options" and choose the wikipedia option (How does this work again).
Hide Direct Migration Control

This decision exists so you can declutter your decision tab after setting your preferences. Once you wish to stop the campaign, simply show the decisions again and stop the campaign via Immigration Options event.
